meanings.definition: The side of a pavement or sidewalk next to the curb.
meanings.sent1: I waited for the bus at the kerbside.
meanings.sent2: The children played hopscotch on the kerbside.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a nut at the kerbside and had a little picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts often wandered to the kerbside of memories.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bloomed beautifully along the kerbside.

meanings.definition: Adjacent to the edge of a road or street.
meanings.sent1: The kerbside parking was convenient for quick stops.
meanings.sent2: The kerbside cafe had outdoor seating for customers.
meanings.sent3: The cat enjoyed the kerbside view, pretending to be a guard.
meanings.sent4: His kerbside manner with customers was always friendly and welcoming.
meanings.sent5: The kerbside market bustled with activity on weekends.
